{{champion:98}} R - Stand United
BUGFIX Fixed a bug where Stand United would occasionally cancel itself

2 years it took them to fix the bug... finally
And the only reason they fixed it is because it caused an issue in a LCS match.
riot cares for more lcs than us no names solo q players.. thats why they shifted the meta to 40-70 minute games

We've actually been working on fixing this bug for at least a year. Unfortunately, despite literally hundreds of man hours of testing, we were never able to find a 100% repro case (or even a 10% one) and claiming to fix something when you can't prove that it's fixed is a super negative player experience. All it takes is one failed fix that costs you a kill for you to stop trusting us when we say we fixed things (and that's not unreasonable).


Ultimately, some of our awesome engineers and designers worked to create some engine and logging improvements so we could track this thing down and resolve it. If you still experience this issue, PLEASE let us know! And if it's a hard to track down issue that you can reproduce 100% of the time on command, by all means share the knowledge!

Thanks for replying to this!  I was kind of inclined to agree the the OP (still think Riot is a bit too focused on competitive play at the expense of the casual crowd, but that's another discussion) and you raised a great point I didn't consider.

Speaking of issues that have bugged players forever...are there any plans to ever squash cases where you flash and die, but the flash should've saved you or you shouldn't have been able to flash in the first place due to being dead (example: flashing away from a melee ability like Garen Q and still having it hit) and end up losing your flash for nothing?  Or is this just a result of latency and the way the engine works that we have to deal with?  I'm sure this has been discussed before but I can't remember what the official word was.

Mandrop is needed. RITO Pls change {{champion:80}} ult to "Mandrop" Pls!

change his title to Mantheon please

Still waiting for Riot to give us an option to toggle the effect of {{item:3068}} ;_;

I second this, it's annoying to automatically take turret aggro if an enemy champion walks up to you. Sometimes you just want to stand there and finish off the turret, but Sunfire makes that more difficult.
junglers goving buffs away.

It's a downside to a bonus effect. That's like asking if Ravenous can be toggled or not because turret aggro goes on you when you hit a minion under turret an the splash hits a champion. Positives and negatives to item effects. I figured it was just a balance to the effect of having bonus wave clear and passive pushing potential. You can push the minions like a boss but you can't really get at the turret yourself.
Muramana has a toggle effect to remove a downside.  Also I always thought the reason for no toggle on Ravenous is because it would be difficult to have that and the active easily accessable.

But if Muramana wasn't a toggle then most people might never pick it up considering you would burn through mana almost instantly when trying to farm.

Other than the occasional enemy near you causing you to take tower aggro, how many long term downsides are there to sunfire? Almost none, and chances are if you are picking up sunfire then you are already tanking the tower like a boss anyways.

i agree so much. i liked it because it forced teams to make choices. if i see that their jungler is going ff and afk farming, i just play vi or panth and gank every time i get the chance. one ff jungler cannot defeat an entire fed team. if i went ff and they did as well, it became a game of cat and mouse trying to cripple eachother's farms (smite stealing small camps like the wolves became important). ff forced decisions, and that's something that the league community cant deal with (although i must say, i will be glad to see less non-jungle mains in the jungle. if you dont know how to jungle, learn how to jungle. that's what youtube is for)
{{champion:121}} NEWGAMEPLAY Turrets now count as allies when determining whether a target is isolated!!!!!!!! ¿REALLY?
Screw him anyway.
This is riot's thinking "everyone loves the Alien vs. Predator champs, so lets nerf them like mad so they become tanks that do no burst damage even thought they were made to be assasins"

The "assassin" role was always intended to be high risk and high reward. the main problem with kha'zix was that in the hands of someone who wasn't brain dead he could nuke two or more people solo in the middle of their entire team and get out alive, or 100 to 0 a midlaner under their turret and live. It's about damned time that little bug got a nerf that puts some risk into his playstyle.
